answer_long: We implement role-based access control using Azure AD groups. Each role is mapped to specific permissions in our application. Users are assigned to roles based on their job function.
All user accounts require multi-factor authentication using Microsoft Authenticator or SMS. Admin accounts require hardware tokens for additional security.
All data at rest is encrypted using AES-256 encryption. Encryption keys are managed using AWS KMS with automatic rotation every 90 days.
Our network is segmented into separate VLANs for production, staging, and development. All traffic is filtered through enterprise firewalls with intrusion detection systems.
We perform daily automated backups of all production databases. Backups are stored in geographically distributed locations and tested quarterly for recovery.
Our security operations center monitors systems 24/7. Incidents are triaged based on severity and escalated according to our incident response playbook.
We conduct monthly vulnerability scans using Qualys. Critical vulnerabilities are patched within 24 hours, high-severity within 7 days.
All employees complete annual security awareness training covering phishing, data handling, and password security. Completion is tracked and required for continued access.
All third-party vendors undergo security assessments before onboarding. We review SOC 2 reports and conduct annual risk reviews for critical vendors.
All production changes require approval from the change advisory board. Emergency changes follow an expedited process with post-implementation review.
